title: Definition of y-intercept
text: The y-intercept describes the point in which the function crosses the y-axis.
speech: The y-intercept describes the point in which the function crosses the y-axis.
pacedSpeech: The y-intercept describes the point in which the function crosses the y-axis.

title: Setting up the equation
text: Let $$x=0$$. Solve the function f(x) $$=$$ $$\ln(5x+10)+3$$. This represents the point in which the function crosses the y-axis.
speech: Let  x is equal to 0 . Solve the function f(x)  is equal to   the natural log of, parentheses, 5 x plus 10,  plus 3 . This represents the point in which the function crosses the y-axis.
pacedSpeech: . Solve the function f(x)   is equal to
the natural log of, , 5 x plus 10,  plus 3
. This represents the point in which the function crosses the y-axis.
